requirement_tested: Create a one-page website for promoting Fundraiser Day
user_persona: A potential donor browsing online to learn about community events.
user_goal: To quickly understand what Fundraiser Day is about and how they can participate.

narrative_steps.title: Landing on Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah discovers the Fundraiser Day website through a shared link and lands on the homepage. She immediately sees the title and description of the event.
narrative_steps.action: Load the webpage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The page loads successfully with a centered heading 'Fundraiser Day', subheading 'Supporting Our Community Together', and descriptive paragraph explaining the event. Background color is cornsilk.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Sections
narrative_steps.description: Curious about the event, Sarah clicks on the 'Learn More' anchor link to smoothly scroll down to the introduction section.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Learn More' anchor link.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page scrolls smoothly to the #event-intro section without reloading or jumping.

requirement_tested: Implement an automatically moving carousel to display offers
user_persona: A visitor interested in special deals available for Fundraiser Day.
user_goal: To view different promotional offers without manual effort initially.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Auto-Rotation
narrative_steps.description: While reading about the event, Mike notices a visually appealing carousel showcasing various offers. It automatically rotates every 5 seconds.
narrative_steps.action: View the carousel without interacting.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Carousel slides change automatically every 5 seconds, displaying images with overlay titles and descriptions.

narrative_steps.title: Pausing the Carousel
narrative_steps.description: Mike wants to read more about the current offer and hovers his mouse over the carousel to pause it.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over the carousel area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Automatic rotation pauses while the mouse remains hovered over the carousel.

narrative_steps.title: Manual Navigation
narrative_steps.description: After reviewing, Mike uses the navigation arrows to move to the next slide manually.
narrative_steps.action: Click the right arrow button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Carousel transitions to the next slide instantly.

requirement_tested: Add a testimonials section for displaying fundraiser stories
user_persona: A first-time visitor looking for reassurance from others’ experiences.
user_goal: To read real stories from people who participated in previous fundraisers.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting Testimonials Section
narrative_steps.description: Emily scrolls down to the testimonials section after seeing the event details.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the testimonials section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A three-column grid of testimonial cards appears, each showing a user photo, name, role, and quote fetched dynamically from the backend API.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Stories
narrative_steps.description: Emily reads several testimonials to gauge the impact of past events.
narrative_steps.action: Read content within testimonial cards.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All card contents render clearly with no broken images or missing text.

user_persona: A local business owner considering sponsorship or collaboration.
user_goal: To find out more about the organizing body behind Fundraiser Day.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Company Info
narrative_steps.description: John reaches the bottom of the page and finds the company information section.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll to the company information section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Section displays a two-column layout—left side shows organization history and right side contains clickable social media icons.

narrative_steps.title: Connecting Socially
narrative_steps.description: Interested in connecting further, John clicks on the Facebook icon.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Facebook social media icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Opens the official Fundraiser Day Facebook profile in a new browser tab.

requirement_tested: Set cornsilk as the main background color
user_goal: To verify that the specified background color is applied throughout the site.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Overall Layout
narrative_steps.description: Lisa inspects the overall look and feel of the website upon loading.
narrative_steps.action: Open developer tools and inspect body styles.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Body element has a background-color style set to 'cornsilk'.

requirement_tested: Use peru for control elements such as buttons and navigation
user_persona: A UI/UX reviewer ensuring brand color usage.
user_goal: To confirm that control components use the correct accent color.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Control Elements
narrative_steps.description: Lisa examines interactive elements like buttons and navigation controls.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect styles of carousel arrows and CTA button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Control elements including carousel arrows and CTA button have their primary color set to 'peru'.

requirement_tested: Ensure all sections are accessible via smooth scrolling or direct links
user_persona: A user preferring quick navigation through anchor links.
user_goal: To jump directly to relevant sections using in-page anchors.

narrative_steps.title: Using Anchor Link
narrative_steps.description: Alex wants to skip ahead to the testimonials and clicks the corresponding navigation link.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Testimonials' anchor link in the header menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page smoothly scrolls to the testimonials section without abrupt jumps.

requirement_tested: Make the website fully responsive across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices
user_persona: A mobile user accessing the website on-the-go.
user_goal: To navigate the website seamlessly on a smartphone screen.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Mobile View
narrative_steps.description: Dana opens the website on her phone and checks the layout adaptation.
narrative_steps.action: Resize browser window to simulate mobile screen size.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts appropriately; carousel stacks vertically, testimonials become single column, and all content fits within viewport.

requirement_tested: Provide a clear call-to-action for users to learn more about the event
user_persona: A casual visitor needing guidance on where to start.
user_goal: To easily locate and engage with the most important action prompt.

narrative_steps.title: Noticing Sticky CTA Bar
narrative_steps.description: While scrolling, Tom sees a sticky CTA bar at the bottom of the screen inviting him to learn more.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the page until reaching mid-content.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Sticky CTA bar becomes visible near the bottom with a prominent 'Learn More About Fundraiser Day' button.

narrative_steps.title: Engaging With CTA Button
narrative_steps.description: Tom clicks the CTA button to return to the top introductory section.
narrative_steps.action: Click the CTA button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page smoothly scrolls back to the #event-intro section.

requirement_tested: Enable users to pause the carousel on hover or interaction
user_persona: A detail-oriented visitor wanting full control over animations.
user_goal: To stop the auto-sliding carousel temporarily for better readability.

narrative_steps.title: Hovering Over Carousel
narrative_steps.description: Maria wants to carefully read the details of the second offer displayed in the carousel.
narrative_steps.action: Move cursor over the carousel container.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Auto-slide stops immediately while cursor remains inside the carousel bounds.

narrative_steps.title: Resuming Auto-Slide
narrative_steps.description: Once done reading, Maria moves her cursor away from the carousel.
narrative_steps.action: Move cursor outside the carousel area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Carousel resumes automatic sliding after cursor leaves the area.

requirement_tested: Support keyboard navigation for accessibility compliance
user_persona: A keyboard-dependent user navigating the site without a mouse.
user_goal: To interact with key features solely using keyboard inputs.

narrative_steps.title: Focusing Carousel
narrative_steps.description: Jamie uses Tab key to reach the carousel component.
narrative_steps.action: Press Tab key multiple times until focus reaches carousel.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Focus outline becomes visible around the active carousel item.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating Slides via Keyboard
narrative_steps.description: With focus on the carousel, Jamie presses the right arrow key to advance.
narrative_steps.action: Press Right Arrow key.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Carousel transitions to the next slide programmatically.

requirement_tested: Optimize page load performance with compressed assets
user_persona: A performance-conscious user with limited bandwidth.
user_goal: To experience fast loading times despite rich media content.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Website
narrative_steps.description: Raj visits the website for the first time using a slow internet connection.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the website URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Website loads completely within acceptable time frame (<3 seconds), with optimized image sizes and minimal HTTP requests.

requirement_tested: Include semantic HTML structure for improved SEO and screen reader support
user_persona: A visually impaired user relying on screen readers.
user_goal: To consume the website's content naturally using assistive technology.

narrative_steps.title: Screen Reader Navigation
narrative_steps.description: Using a screen reader, Alex listens to the structured headings and landmarks of the page.
narrative_steps.action: Activate screen reader and traverse through the page sections.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Headings (H1-H3) are properly nested and announced logically. Landmarks identify major regions like header, main, and footer.

requirement_tested: Add social media sharing capabilities for event promotion
user_persona: An enthusiastic supporter wanting to spread awareness.
user_goal: To share the event page effortlessly on social networks.

narrative_steps.title: Finding Share Buttons
narrative_steps.description: Excited about the event, Priya looks for ways to share it with friends.
narrative_steps.action: Look for social sharing options on the left edge of the screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Floating sidebar with branded share buttons (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn) aligned vertically is visible.

narrative_steps.title: Sharing on Social Media
narrative_steps.description: Priya decides to share on Facebook and clicks the corresponding button.
narrative_steps.action: Click the Facebook share button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Native Facebook sharing dialog opens pre-filled with the event page URL.
